instructions:
Heat water and butter to boiling point, stir in flour all at once. Stir constantly with wooden spoon until
mixture leaves the pan and forms into a ball *(about l minute)*. Remove from heat. Cool. Beat in l at a time 2
eggs, beating until smooth after each addition. Beat until mixture is smooth and velvety. Drop from spoon in
6 mounds, 3 inches apart, onto lightly greased baking sheet. Bake about 15 minutes at 450 F until puffs have
fully expanded; then bake 30 to 35 minutes more at 350 F. When baked, allow to cool slowly, away from
drafts. When cream puffs are cool, cut off tops with sharp knife. Scoop put any filaments of soft dough with
spoon, and then fill the puffs with sweetened whipped cream, ice cream, cooled soft custard, or any desired
filling. Replace tops. Dust with confectioners' sugar or thin chocolate icing. Makes 6 puffs.
name: Cream Puffs
creator: Betty Crocker
